intro: Bupleurum semicompositum, commonly known as the lesser bupleurum, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Russia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a long taproot that allows it to thrive in well-drained soils. Its botanical features include aromatic leaves and a distinctive, branched stem that supports its delicate inflorescence.
